info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, southeastern Macon, southern Transylvania, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Greenville, northern Pickens and northern Oconee Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Brevard to 18 miles northwest of Pickens to 9 miles north of Clayton. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Highlands, Rosman, Sky Valley, Cashiers, Jocassee Gorges, Devils Fork State Park, Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Jones Gap State Park and Lake Jocassee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
